case_vignette: A 60-year-old man presents to the clinic with a 1-cm long horn-like projection coming from the skin on the superior aspect of the skull just lateral to midline. The structure is yellowish-white in color and feels very firm to the touch. He states that he noticed a small, hard lesion a few months ago and that it has grown progressively larger from the time of initial presentation to now. The patient denies any pain at rest but states that he experiences pain when the lesion is struck accidentally.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've got this bony-like thing sticking out on the top of my head, a bit to the side, that's been growing bigger over the last few months.
How old are you?
I am 60 years old.
Have you had any recent trauma or injury to your head?
No, I haven't had any recent injuries to my head.
Do you have any other symptoms like headaches or vision changes?
No, I haven't had any headaches or changes in my vision.
Have you had any previous skin conditions or growths in that area?
No, I haven't had skin conditions or growths in that area before this.
Do you take any medications or have any medical conditions that affect your bone health, such as osteoporosis?
I haven't mentioned any medications or medical conditions that affect my bone health.
Is there a family history of bone or skin conditions?
I haven't said anything about my family having bone or skin conditions.
**Final Diagnosis:** Cutaneous Horn
